intro: Joannegria brizoides, commonly known as the silverleaf beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and spikes of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity. Joannegria brizoides is often found in open habitats like grasslands and along stream banks.
